intro: Ranunculus abchasicus, commonly known as the Abchazian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and has trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers consist of numerous petal-like sepals and are often accompanied by yellow stamens. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil.
